items.title: Awesome Cdk
items.content_text:
### Training Materials and Sample Code / Multi-accounts setup

*   [Create and Publish CDK Constructs Using projen and jsii (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/seeebiii/projen-test) - A step-by-step guide with sample code to create a new CDK construct using [projen (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/projen/projen) and `jsii` and publish it to npm, Maven Central, PyPi and NuGet.

items.title: Awesome Jmeter

### Community / Blogs

items.title: Public Apis
items.content_text:
### Geocoding

- API: [Geocode.xyz](https://geocode.xyz/api)

  Description: Provides worldwide forward/reverse geocoding, batch geocoding and geoparsing

  Auth: No

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Unknown



### Government

- API: [Data.parliament.uk](https://explore.data.parliament.uk/?learnmore=Members)

  Description: Contains live datasets including information about petitions, bills, MP votes, attendance and more

  Auth: No

  HTTPS: No

  CORS: Unknown



### Jobs

- API: [GraphQL Jobs](https://graphql.jobs/docs/api/)

  Description: Jobs with GraphQL

  Auth: No

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Yes



### Science & Math

- API: [GBIF](https://www.gbif.org/developer/summary)

  Description: Global Biodiversity Information Facility

  Auth: No

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Yes


- API: [Launch Library 2](https://thespacedevs.com/llapi)

  Description: Spaceflight launches and events database

  Auth: No

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Yes



### Text Analysis

- API: [Aylien Text Analysis](https://docs.aylien.com/textapi/#getting-started)

  Description: A collection of information retrieval and natural language APIs

  Auth: `apiKey`

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Unknown



### Transportation

- API: [Amadeus for Developers](https://developers.amadeus.com/self-service)

  Description: Travel Search - Limited usage

  Auth: `OAuth`

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Unknown



### Weather

- API: [Foreca](https://developer.foreca.com)

  Description: Weather

  Auth: `OAuth`

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Unknown
items.content_html:
Geocoding

  • API: Geocode.xyz

    Description: Provides worldwide forward/reverse geocoding, batch geocoding and geoparsing

    Auth: No

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Unknown

Government

  • API: Data.parliament.uk

    Auth: No

    HTTPS: No

    CORS: Unknown

    Auth: No

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Yes

Science & Math

  • API: GBIF

    Description: Global Biodiversity Information Facility

    Auth: No

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Yes

  • API: Launch Library 2

    Description: Spaceflight launches and events database

    Auth: No

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Yes

Text Analysis

  • API: Aylien Text Analysis

    Description: A collection of information retrieval and natural language APIs

    Auth: apiKey

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Unknown

Transportation

  • API: Amadeus for Developers

    Description: Travel Search - Limited usage

    Auth: OAuth

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Unknown

Weather

  • API: Foreca

    Description: Weather

    Auth: OAuth

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Unknown

items.title: Awesome Sitecore
items.content_text:
### Deployment

*   [Cake.Sitecore (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/asmagin/Cake.Sitecore) - Provides a set of pre-build \[CAKE build] tasks to be used to simplify a configuration of CI/CD for Helix-based Sitecore projects.

### Frameworks

*   [NitroNet for Sitecore (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/merkle-open/NitroNetSitecore) - Handles all possible presentation scenarios to integrate a handlebars frontend into Sitecore instead of Razor View without functional loss and improving productivity.
items.content_html:
Deployment

  • Cake.Sitecore (‚≠ê11) - Provides a set of pre-build [CAKE build] tasks to be used to simplify a configuration of CI/CD for Helix-based Sitecore projects.

Frameworks

  • NitroNet for Sitecore (‚≠ê24) - Handles all possible presentation scenarios to integrate a handlebars frontend into Sitecore instead of Razor View without functional loss and improving productivity.

items.title: Awesome Rails
items.content_text:
### Official Resources

*   [Rails Official Website](https://rubyonrails.org)
*   [Rails Official Guide](https://guides.rubyonrails.org)
*   [Rails Official Guide (Edge Guide)](https://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org)
*   [Rails API Documentation](https://api.rubyonrails.org)
*   [Rails Source Code (‚≠ê57k)](https://github.com/rails/rails)

### Articles / Other external resources

*   [I created the same application with Rails and no JavaScript](https://dev.to/mario_chavez/i-created-the-same-application-with-rails-and-no-javascript-288o)

### Open Source Rails Apps / Other external resources

*   [adopt-a-hydrant (‚≠ê740)](https://github.com/codeforamerica/adopt-a-hydrant) - A civic infrastructure detection app (using Rails 4.2).
*   [askaway (‚≠ê33)](https://github.com/askaway/askaway) - Question & answer app specialized in politics (using Rails 4.1).
*   [brimir (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/ivaldi/brimir) - An email helpdesk app (using Rails 5.2). (archived).
*   [ciao (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/brotandgames/ciao) - A URL status checking app (using Rails 6.0).
*   [coRM (‚≠ê27)](https://github.com/SIGIRE/CoRM) - A customer relationship management app - using Rails 3.2 - [:earth\_africa:](http://www.corm.fr)
*   [coderwall (legacy) (‚≠ê858)](https://github.com/coderwall/coderwall-legacy) - A social network app for software engineers - using Rails 3.2
*   [coderwall (next) (‚≠ê203)](https://github.com/coderwall/coderwall-next) - A social network app for software engineers - using Rails 5.0
*   [contribulator (‚≠ê85)](https://github.com/24pullrequests/contribulator) - An open source project finder app - using Rails 5.1
*   [covoiturage-libre (‚≠ê112)](https://github.com/covoiturage-libre/covoiturage-libre) - A carpooling app - using Rails 5.0 (archived).
*   [encrypt.to (‚≠ê141)](https://github.com/encrypt-to/encrypt.to) - A messaging app with encryption support (using Rails 4.2).
*   [follow-all (‚≠ê81)](https://github.com/codeforamerica/follow-all) - A Twitter account management app (using Rails 4.2). (archived).
*   [helpy (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/helpyio/helpy) - A customer support app (using Rails 4.2). - [:earth\_africa:](https://helpy.io/)
*   [intercityup.com (‚≠ê115)](https://github.com/intercity/intercity-next) - A control panel app for app deployment (using Rails 4.1).
*   [kitsu-tools (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/hummingbird-me/kitsu-tools) - An anime discovery platform (using Rails 4.1).
*   [lavish (‚≠ê690)](https://github.com/mquan/lavish) - A color scheme generator (using Rails 4.2).
*   [lifeToRemind (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/eduqg/LifeToRemind) - A career planning app (using Rails 5.2).
*   [obtvse2 (‚≠ê256)](https://github.com/natew/obtvse2) - A blogging app (using Rails 4.0).
*   [onebody (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/seven1m/onebody) - A social networking app for churches - using Rails 5.1
*   [opencongress (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/sunlightlabs/opencongress) - A website for getting information about US Congress - using Rails 3.0 (archived).
*   [rentmybikes-rails (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/balanced/rentmybikes-rails) - A marketplace app - (using Rails 4.0).
*   [selfstarter (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/apigy/selfstarter) - A crowdfunding app (using Rails 4.0).
*   [sharetribe (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/sharetribe/sharetribe) - A peer-to-peer marketplace platform (using Rails 5.2). - [:earth\_africa:](https://www.sharetribe.com)
*   [socify (‚≠ê376)](https://github.com/scaffeinate/socify) - A social networking platform - using Rails 5.0
*   [splits-io (‚≠ê141)](https://github.com/glacials/splits-io) - A speedrun data store and analysis engine. (using Rails 6.0). - [:earth\_africa:](https://splits.io)
*   [spokenvote (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/Spokenvote/spokenvote) - A social voting app (using Rails 4.2).
*   [stackneveroverflow (‚≠ê166)](https://github.com/liaoziyang/stackneveroverflow) - A question asking & answering platform - using Rails 5.0
*   [teambox (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/redbooth/teambox) - A collaboration app - using Rails 3.0 - [:earth\_africa:](https://redbooth.com) (archived).
*   [trado (‚≠ê154)](https://github.com/Jellyfishboy/trado) - An e-commerce platform (using Rails 4.2).
*   [whitehall (‚≠ê952)](https://github.com/alphagov/whitehall) - A content management app used by UK government - using Rails 7.0
    [Back to top](#table-of-contents)

### Gems / Other external resources

*   [avo (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/avo-hq/avo) - Configuration-based, no-maintenance, extendable Ruby on Rails admin panel. [rubygems](https://rubygems.org/gems/avo)

### DevTools / Other external resources

*   [Optic (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/opticdev/optic) - Optic automatically documents and tests your APIs.
items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Ansible
items.content_text:
### Tutorials

*   [How To Manage Remote Servers with Ansible](https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorial_series/how-to-manage-remote-servers-with-ansible) - This Tutorial goes over how to use Ansible to manage remote servers.
*   [Ansible Tutorials on DigitalOcean](https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tags/ansible?subtype=tutorial) - Basic tutorials on DigitalOcean.com.

### Books

*   [How To Manage Remote Servers with Ansible eBook](https://www.digitalocean.com/community/books/how-to-manage-remote-servers-with-ansible-ebook) - This book is based on the "How To Manage Remote Servers with Ansible" tutorial series.
items.content_html:
Tutorials

  • How To Manage Remote Servers with Ansible - This Tutorial goes over how to use Ansible to manage remote servers.
  • Ansible Tutorials on DigitalOcean - Basic tutorials on DigitalOcean.com.
